8E2EA69135444E79BE2790F352628BA6.description: Record the number of objects in a given set using tally marks.

Students will be expected to name, describe, compare, create, and sort regular and irregular

number of sides.

Students will be expected to demonstrate an understanding of perimeter of regular, irregular, and

C07BC7273770437FB7B763C7A12CD720.description: Solve a given problem involving the number of seconds in a minute, the number of minutes in an hour, the number of hours in a day, or the number of days in a given month.

4BB8ECE15D314CD6B707F17F1766CA02.description:
Students will be expected to relate the number of seconds to a minute, the numbers of minutes
to an hour, the numbers of hours to a day, and the number of days to a month in a problem-solving
context.

96CFABEB316E43AEB69CBB504C06A054.description:
Students will be expected to relate the passage of time to common activities using standard
units (minutes, hours, days, weeks, months, years).

4BC695432D394D74B547728F8029923D.description: Explain why the unknown in a given addition or subtraction equation has only one value.

184FD1FD71E84F40B64AFD83F326D914.description: Solve a given addition or subtraction equation that represents combining or separating actions with one unknown using manipulatives.

240062221EFA4C9E962F72CA00582326.description:

F50BBE0C23BC428BBFB47D845251F9DA.description:
Students will be expected to demonstrate an understanding of increasing patterns by
describing, extending, comparing, and creating numerical (numbers to 1000) patterns and nonnumerical patterns using manipulatives, diagrams, sounds, and actions.

D9E29B7D659F40BA951E80BAE1606504.description: Describe a mental mathematics strategy that could be used to determine a given basic subtraction fact with minuends up to 18 and subtrahends up to 9.

DBF91FF71EB446E4963C3DDF985D2184.description: Explain how the commutative (order-doesn’t-matter) property and the identity (no-changewith-zero) property can assist in addition fact learning.

558B4BC6C97A41F480B8D8FF26C595F4.description:

develop quick recall of basic addition facts to 18 and related basic subtraction facts.

F3E94E2CFCA24B6FADD6AD9785333DF8.description: Determine the difference of two given numbers using a personal strategy, e.g., for 127 – 38, record 2 + 80 + or 127 – 20 – 10 – 8.

2F6AB160204743B095F3E21091F4AC3F.description: Determine the sum of two given numbers using a personal strategy, e.g., for 326 + 48, record 300 + 60 + 14.

6FF598817B17434C9765331AACDCD4BC.description: Create an addition or subtraction story problem for a given solution.

20CCCB9D4C2C437DA3A24685728A2C87.description: Model the subtraction of two given numbers using concrete or visual representations and record the process symbolically.

F68398CA96254F30ACE5B5D5F8A61B55.description: creating and solving problems in context that involve addition and subtraction of numbers concretely, pictorially, and symbolically

766D49902DD6435A85534EFD2F70743F.description:
Students will be expected to apply estimation strategies to predict sums and differences of 1-, 2-,
and 3-digit numerals in a problem-solving context.

17F2C823C45C4FD6A432D651F86873F2.description: Determine a difference of two 2-digit numerals efficiently, using mental mathematics strategies

8C409AF1B04D40B392ED36846AAD6BE0.description: Use and describe a personal strategy for determining a difference.

330309BEDA6944D1A4C794F55808855F.description:
Students will be expected to describe and apply mental mathematics strategies for subtracting
two 2-digit numerals.

E8B3B50A57924F7AB23D57D5B6D35699.description: Determine a sum of two 2-digit numerals efficiently, using mental mathematics strategies.

83FC01A80D9F40DD8829D2398DAD4BD6.description: Use and describe a personal strategy for determining a sum.

Students will be expected to describe and apply mental mathematics strategies for adding two 2-
digit numerals.

1169934B0B944B019BE7BE914D62B250.description: Record a given number in additive expanded form.

94E3C49399B74E4190D65BB056DCBB5B.description: Record, in more than one way, the number represented by given proportional and nonproportional concrete materials in traditional and non-conventional formats.

38889819032B493CB1F00706E5210932.description:
Students will be expected to illustrate, concretely and pictorially, the meaning of place value for
numerals to 1000.

61DE3AF678E544BBA40FC1B60820998F.description: Select and justify a referent for determining an estimate for a given quantity

D3D626C90FD5400DBFEA71E8FDA0E6D0.description: Select an estimate for a given quantity by choosing among three possible choices.

0E70146414F348E6BB6174904DB7CF3B.description: Estimate a given quantity by comparing it to a referent.

27008436E6B14113873D28D627D2A4B8.description: Estimate the number of groups of a hundred in a given quantity using 100 as a referent.

171BBB589BF948018106EAC1C5DDCA7A.description: Estimate the number of groups of ten in a given quantity using 10 as a referent(known quantity).

99832903B4084BAFB5DBA1E67F876408.description: Students will be expected to estimate quantities less than 1000 using referents.

5BCF354A33E54BF7B3B6773B3289D93E.description: Compare numbers based on a variety of methods, and record the comparison using words and symbols (=, > and <).

8A5D13A9BA9746D6B7DB2F69517D1ACA.description: Place numbers on a number line containing benchmark numbers for the purpose of comparison.

7B3DC71A07284158B12FD49EEE4CCDE2.description: Identify errors in a given number chart and on a number line.

36B10E38CE05423691DE4A0BA7819BDE.description: Identify missing numbers in parts of a given number chart and on a number line.

18A8CB5FCA82405E8141B3652BA62EB5.description: Create as many different 3-digit numerals as possible, given three different digits. Place the numbers in ascending or descending order.

DE301B1C09FC420A9546050B74F0C35D.description: Place a given set of numbers in ascending or descending order and verify the result using a number chart or other models.

4426F807837140A68DB68A9FF084606D.description: Students will be expected to compare and order numbers up to 1000.
